item.description: The book for May is The Lover by Marguerite Duras. (Note that Brookline Booksmith has a pile on their remainder table.) For June we are considering taking a detour into non-fiction with Ryszard Kapuscinski's astonishing The Emperor. The book is set in 1974, when Haile Selassie, who had been emperor of Ethiopa for more than forty years, was thrown out. Kapuscinski interviewed members of the palace staff about life as part of a world that was by then thousands of years old and had, over that time, transmorgified into something just spectacularly weird.
